articles.author: AFP
articles.title: Europe Covid resurgence: WHO fears 700,000 more deaths - Hindustan Times
articles.description: Some 700,000 could die in the coming months, the WHO said, as cases creep up across Europe, prompting some countries to reimpose tough restrictions. | World News
articles.content:
Europe remains "in the firm grip" of Covid and the death toll on the continent could top 2.2 million this winter if current trends continue, the World Health Organization said Tuesday.

articles.title: Covid deaths in Europe to top 2 million by March, says WHO - The Guardian
articles.description: Dr Hans Kluge describes situation as ‘very serious’ with increasing strain on health services
articles.content: Total deaths across Europe from Covid-19 are likely to exceed 2 million by March next year, the World Health Organization (WHO) has said, adding that the pandemic had become the number one cause of d… [+3452 chars]

articles.title: NASA Webb telescope launch delayed after incident - CTV News
articles.description: The European Space Agency says the launch of a new NASA telescope to replace the famed Hubble observatory is being postponed to allow experts to check the device for possible damage following an incident at its spaceport in French Guiana.
articles.content:
